title: It was said before, and I will say it again: Don't Remove Normal Draft
body:
http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/competitive/how-rank-2017-season

Please Riot. Normal Draft is an amazing concept; it takes the freedom to play anything in normals with the format of ranked. It is great for teaching new players how to play ranked games while also helping people who want to get better at ranked, but don't want to risk losing LP when learning new champions.

Spread the word people! With enough outcry on the boards, we were able to make Riot reconsider item sets. If we give this enough attention, we could change Riot's mind once again.

replies.body: They're removing it from regions where no one played it, everyone calm the fuck down.

They said that in an ideal world, it would be removed from all regions.

That is legitimate cause for concern.

I could see it being removed to try and improve queue health for ranked. And I don't see a problem with that really if more folks are pushed into ranked. I plan to use flex queue as my normal draft anyway going forward and solo q as my serious mode.

I don't want to play ranked all the time.

Sometimes, I want to practice while having:

* Roles assigned (instead of people autolocking and arguing over roles)
* The opportunity to counter-pick (and be countered)
* The opportunity to ban champions
* The ability to see the enemy's team composition

Blind Pick is an abomination which only really benefits new players (who don't know how bans work) or people who want to play highly contested champions (who would be picked by the enemy team or banned otherwise).

If you are going to have a practice mode, you are better off having it be similar to the competitive mode in format to avoid confusing and issues with players just starting to play ranked.

While Flex Queue is definitely going to be the casual ranked mode, I would still prefer not having to practice new roles or champions in it.  That just screws everyone else over (especially if everyone begins doing it).

To your first point, Honestly... I ducking hate normal blind pick.  I want to play the game and play the role I want to play without having to have "adc"  or "jg"  or "mid"  loaded on the clipboard and play a game of "who gets first dibs" every time I play a game.
Don't forget contesting with whatever idiot autolocked their champion without speaking.

I've had Orianna jungle in my promos before and they did perfectly fine. It isn't the champion, it's the player.

You'd really ruin 4 other players ranked experience rather than go into blind mode?

There isn't really other choice though is there? Try calling jungle and locking Soraka on a blind mode and see if they'll respect your call. No way I'm dealing with that pre-match bickering crap again. Even if it's not a troll pick like Soraka jg, maybe you just want to practice a new legit champion and want to have a 50% chance you'll land your role instead of a 20%. And that's assuming people are going to respect first calls, we all know how much instalocks and mid-or-feed is common in blinds.
No, I don't. The difference between ranked and normal draft is a mental construct. May as well break it down and help people get past their own insecurity.
Or maybe people just like normal draft?

Just because it's what they want in an ideal world doesn't mean they will force the game to change so that people have to conform that way.
